8.title: A Time of Crisis; Abraham Lincoln and the Case for Union.
8.plot: When Abraham Lincoln was inaugurated, he became president of a fractured Union. America was poised for what would become the bloodiest chapter in its young history. The Civil War killed more Americans than all our other wars combined. It was only through Lincoln's strength, dedication, and faith that the Union survived.

1.title: The New World
1.plot: From the Renaissance to the Reformation and colonization, meet pioneers in science, religion, and exploration that paved the way to a New World and the birth of a nation.

2.title: Seeds of Independence
2.plot: Discover George Washington and his experience with the French and Indian War. Then, find out what happened when the British government began taxing the colonies without their consent.

3.title: Trigger of the Revolution
3.plot: See what happens when pilgrims tire of oppression and seek religious freedom-and Sam Adams, John Adams, and John Hancock become the architects of American independence.

4.title: The Die Has Now Been Cast
4.plot: Find out what happens when the fervor for a revolution is fueled by Paul Revere's famous ride, the Boston Tea Party, and the battles of Lexington and Concord.

5.title: The Miracle of Ticonderoga
5.plot: The Second Continental Congress meets in Philadelphia. Emotions run high as General Ethan Allen is deployed to deal with the British at Ticonderoga. Washington lays siege to British-held Boston.

6.title: We Hold These Truths to Be Self-Evident
6.plot: See what happens when the Second Continental Congress votes to create a document that will declare to the world that America will be free.

7.title: The Miracle at New York
7.plot: When General Howe brings an invasion to the battle of Brooklyn Heights, Washington's miraculous retreat to Manhattan saves the Continental Army.

8.title: The Crisis
8.plot: Washington does the unthinkable when he crosses the frozen Delaware for surprise attacks that will keep the patriot cause alive.

9.title: The Battle of Saratoga
9.plot: The great American victory at Saratoga makes France an ally of the new United States and turns the revolution into world war.

10.title: Refiner's Fire
10.plot: George Washington and the Continental Army endure the harsh winter at Valley Forge.

11.title: The War Goes South
11.plot: When Washington and the Continental army charge out of Valley Forge, the British change their strategy and take the war south.

12.title: Victory of the Common Man
12.plot: The unruly "Overmountain Boys" crush the loyalists at Kings Mountain; General Daniel Morgan rediscovers modern tactics at Cowpens; and General Nathaniel Greene continues the war of attrition.

13.title: Patriots' Finest Hour
13.plot: Learn about the nautical hero John Paul Jones, the great victory at Yorktown, and the French and American navies.

1.title: We the People-A Miracle
1.plot: A government for the people, by the people is formed during the second Constitutional Convention.

2.title: Now What? Doubling Our Size
2.plot: Washington defines the role of the president and the Louisiana Purchase doubles the size of the United States.

3.title: Into the Great Unknown
3.plot: Lewis and Clark map and explore the wilderness west of the Mississippi in search of the Northwest Passage.

4.title: Hanging on to What We've Got
4.plot: Tensions flare between America and Great Britain, and the War of 1812 begins.

5.title: Discovery Continues
5.plot: Westward expansion begins as famed frontiersman Daniel Boone leads settlers into the great unknown.

6.title: The Mountain Men
6.plot: Travel with mountain men into the American west and learn about everything from the Astor expedition to the rendezvous of Jim Bridger.

7.title: Rivers & Railroads
7.plot: Take a giant leap forward with the new technology of the steam engine, and see how American traffic and trade change across the nation--from steamships in the south to mighty locomotives in the North.

8.title: The Growing Stain of Slavery
8.plot: From Harriet Tubman to Frederick Douglass--meet the people who tried to solve the paradox of slavery in America.

9.title: From Sea to Shining Sea
9.plot: Learn about the growing pains and sectional tensions between the North and the South as the nation expands across the continent.

10.title: Go West, Young Man
10.plot: Explore the pioneering spirit of westward expansion by following the Oregon trail, discovering the California coast, and settling into the high mountains of Utah.

11.title: Moving Forward
11.plot: As the nation expands across the continent, find a way to keep in touch with the Pony Express, stage coach, and telegraph.

12.title: Different VIsions, Different Dreams
12.plot: Explore the two early American visions which inevitably tried to tear the country apart in the split between industry and agriculture.

13.title: A House Divided
13.plot: Harriet Beecher Stowe's "Uncle Tom's Cabin" and the actions of the violent abolitionist John Brown irreparably sever the union and send the nation toward Civil War.

1.title: Mr. Lincoln's War
1.plot: Learn about the struggles of an unassuming "backwoods" lawyer who became a powerful political voice and the champion of the Union.

2.title: The Fires of Secession
2.plot: Hear the first shots of the Civil War and travel from coast to coast seeing the tragic consequences that followed.

3.title: From the Jaws of Victory (They Snatched Defeat)
3.plot: Take a look at Civil War battles where the victors clinched their success against all odds.

4.title: The Cost of Freedom
4.plot: The new technology of the industrial revolution makes the weapons of war even more destructive.

5.title: Changing of the Guard: Lee and Grant
5.plot: Learn about the genius of General Robert E. Lee, the last great warrior of the Napoleonic age, and discover what made General Grant the first warrior of a new era.

6.title: Gettysburg
6.plot: Learn how close the South came to winning this critical battle and how Gettysburg became the turning point of the war.

7.title: Price of Honor
7.plot: Learn about the Emancipation Proclamation, the Battle of Chattanooga, and other events surrounding the American Civil War.

8.title: March to the Sea
8.plot: General William T. Sherman may be the most vilified man of the war, but he is a man who did not burn Atlanta or Charleston and was very friendly to the southern point of view.

9.title: On to Richmond
9.plot: In General Grant's Wilderness Campaign, the Union army suffers defeat after defeat. Despite these victories, General Lee feels the pressure of Grant's army and the inexhaustible resources of the North.

10.title: Lost Cause
10.plot: Confederate General John Bell Hood launches an invasion of union held Tennessee and General Jubal Early strikes at the federal capitol of Washington, DC. Generals Grant and Lee glare out at each other at the siege of Petersburg.

11.title: Brothers Again
11.plot: Witness the remarkable meeting of General Grant with General Lee, where they begin to heal the nation's wounds.

12.title: The Rest of the Story
12.plot: After the Civil War, many men were reunited as "brothers" while others continued to fight a war of words.

13.title: Legacy of Lincoln
13.plot: The end of the war brings a new hope for the nation, but one last tragic price must be paid for the victory of the Union and freedom.

1.title: Dust in the Wind
1.plot: The Civil War is over, but the nation is still divided. Explore the difficulties of putting a nation back together and how the end of the war led to the opening of the Wild West.

2.title: Rails, Trails and Boomtowns
2.plot: The American dream is alive once again, and the dreamers are heading west into wild country. Examine the wagon trains and steam trains, the gold and silver strikes, and the boomtowns that came and went.

3.title: Wanderers, Vagabonds, Drifters and Saddletramps
3.plot: Explore the business of beef: the cattle drives from Texas to the railways hundreds of miles to the north, the men who made the money, and the cowboys who did the real work.

4.title: Bad Company
4.plot: The West is growing, business is expanding, and civilization is on its way, both good and bad. Meet some of the men, and ladies, who put the "Wild" into the Wild West, including the notorious James Gang.

5.title: Order from Chaos
5.plot: Civilization is taking hold in the West, and people are demanding law and order. Enter the lawman, a man who might be of dubious character, but he's good with a gun, and he's got a badge.

6.title: Lookin' Fer Trouble
6.plot: Take a look at the myths and truths about famous gunfights in the Wild West. Both justice and business were dispensed at the end of a gun, and once in a while a fight over a woman, a card game, or an insult was ended with a gun.

7.title: The Earps
7.plot: Learn about the Earps, the most iconic name of the Old West. Follow the trail of Wyatt, his brothers, and his pal Doc Holliday, and discover how most of their reputation and legacy was earned at the O.K. Corral.

8.title: How the West Was Lost
8.plot: Ride with Stan and learn the story of the Westward expansion from the point of view of the people of the Lakota and Cheyenne nations.

9.title: How the West Was Lost II
9.plot: Witness the quest of two great Native American leaders hoping to keep their people free. Ride the trails of Chief Joseph and the last free Apache, Geronimo, who became an American folk hero.

10.title: Range Wars
10.plot: Cattle barons fight to maintain their power and money.

11.title: The Barbary Coast: End of an Era
11.plot: The sun sets on the days of the Wild West: civilization closes down the wide-open spaces, and the lawless have been pushed to the edge of the California coast.

12.title: The Last Round-Up
12.plot: Ride with Stan as he recounts the end of the last confederate, Jesse James, and discovers where Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid committed some of the most daring and successful train robberies in history.

13.title: The Romance and Mystique of the American West
13.plot: The Wild West and the American cowboy become larger than life with tall tales and dime novels of frontier adventures.

1.title: Time for a Change
1.plot: American politics in the Gilded Age was rife with graft and corruption. The American people demanded something different. Could presidents Hayes, Garfield, Arthur, and Cleveland be the right men when America felt it was time for a change?

2.title: Immigrant Song
2.plot: The Gilded Age saw a boom in immigration to the United States. The Statue of Liberty had lifter her lamp "beside the golden door" and the poor and weary of the world came to enjoy the blessings of freedom and the hope of a new beginning.

1.title: FDR
1.plot: As the Great Depression worsens, people's hopes are fading fast. Just when things seem the worst, Franklin Roosevelt promises that "Happy Day Are Here Again." Will the New Deal save America from the most devastating economic disaster in modern history?

2.title: Day of Infamy
2.plot: The clouds of war again cover the earth. Despite efforts to stay neutral, a dastardly sneak attack shatters the American dream of peace, forcing the United States into World War II and the world-wide struggle for freedom against tyranny.

3.title: The Giant Arises
3.plot: After the Japanese attack in the Pacific, America prepares for war. The most incredible industrial transformation in history turns America into an unrivaled military power as American men and women go to work and war to keep our nation free.

1.title: Sand, Surf, and Celebration: Miami
1.plot: Explore Florida's obsession with youth from Juan Ponce de Leon and his famous fountain to the celebration that is Miami. From the architecture to the cultures and colorful communities, it's a celebration for the senses.

2.title: Southern Belles: Charleston and Savannah
2.plot: Two colonies started with hope and promise, went through dark days, and reemerged as cities of light. Ride with us through mysterious Savannah, Georgia and Charleston, South Carolina.

1.title: Atlanta: City of Dreams
1.plot: If it weren't for Atlanta, Georgia - the boyhood home of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. - there may never have been a Selma or Montgomery. It was in Atlanta that he learned the life lessons that would lead him to a ministry of change the world for all.

2.title: Kentucky Thunder
2.plot: The home of the world famous Kentucky Horse Park--the place for all things horse--is set deep in the rolling hills of Bluegrass Country.

3.title: Ol' Man River
3.plot: There was a time when the riverboat was the backbone of American transit and trade in Memphis, Tennessee. In those days, cotton was king and the Mississippi River brought wealth and importance.

4.title: Music City
4.plot: Throughout her history, Nashville has been many things--a hunting camp, a last outpost, and a gateway to the American wilderness. Today she is the repository and guardian of America's home grown music.

5.title: California Dreamin'
5.plot: California's coastal highway is one of the most beautiful and romantic rides in the world. The history of art, literature, and architecture that is found here proves that magic happens where the mountains meet the sea!

6.title: City by the Bay
6.plot: San Francisco has seen her share of hard times and tragedy. The story of Angel Island stands in stark contrast to the vibrant and lively Chinatown of present day San Francisco. Today she is a shining jewel of America's Pacific coast.

7.title: Redwoods
7.plot: There are trees, then there are the mighty Redwoods of Northern California. Most of these trees predate our republic and grow taller than the Statue of Liberty. Learn about the efforts to save these giants.

imdb.title: American Ride
plot: This is a TV show about history as told by the Harley riding Stan Ellsworth, as he travels around the country on his bike.
